column5: Hey guys .... I'm about to drive roughly 7 hours north with the boat and I wasn't sure if I should take the minn Kota off or if I should just strap the head down and take off ? It would take a bit of work to get it off ....  Thanks !
If it a bow mount just strap it down.
I keep it unplugged, strapped down and have driven 1,000 miles each way with no problems!
Ya, you have nothing to worry about. They're pretty tough.  S.
If i put a little torque on the shaft of the terrova, it won't hurt anything right ? I have put a bungee strap on it and it works pretty good !
You will be fine. Have drove long ways with them on. Plus think the abuse it goes through when your moving out on the lake and hitting waves.
I usually take mine off on long trips
Same here.   I just let it on.  Never had a problem.

You wont hurt it by a little tension with a bungee. I have seen me drift up against a rock at the French while fighting a fish and make the shaft look like a bow (not recommended). They will flex quite a bit.

If you're going to leave it on the boat, it might be better to let it bounce a little. In my opinion, the shock of having it tightly secured is probably more harsh on the circuitry than having the head bounce a little bit.
